snippet: A judge’s ruling means that millions will be able to obtain health insurance subsidies, whether they buy coverage through the federal insurance exchange or one of the marketplaces run by the states.
abstract: Federal Judge Paul L Friedman rejects legal challenge to a central part of health care reform law; rules that millions of low- and moderate-income people could obtain health insurance subsidies regardless of whether they bought coverage through the federal insurance exchange or in the marketplaces run by the states; critics of law had said literal reading of it would allow subsidies in only 14 states, argument Friedman rejects.
lead_paragraph: A judge’s ruling means that millions will be able to obtain health insurance subsidies, whether they buy coverage through the federal insurance exchange or one of the marketplaces run by the states.

headline.main: Federal Judge Upholds Health Care Subsidies
headline.print_headline: Federal Judge Upholds Health Care Subsidies

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
